headline: Kalbi (Korean BBQ Short Ribs)
description: Kalbi is a traditional Korean BBQ beef short rib dish marinated in a sweet soy mixture with garlic and green onion, grilled to caramelized perfection.

video.description: Traditional Korean barbecued beef ribs marinate in a sweet soy sauce.
video.name: Kalbi (Korean BBQ Short Ribs)

name: Kalbi (Korean BBQ Short Ribs)
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds Korean-style short ribs (beef chuck flanken, cut 1/3 to 1/2 inch thick across bones)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together soy sauce, brown sugar, water, green onions, garlic, and sesame oil in a bowl until sugar has dissolved.
Place ribs in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over ribs. Seal the bag and refrigerate for 3 hours to overnight.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat; lightly oil the grate.
Remove ribs from the bag; shake off excess marinade and discard marinade. Grill ribs on the preheated grill until meat is still pink but not bloody nearest the bone, 5 to 7 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: Very good basic Kalbi recipe that is no frills and has most of the important ingredients listed, and none of the extraneous niche ones that you might not have around or are hard to find. My only notes are that adding toasted sesame seeds to the marinade to taste is a good idea, and that many soy sauces (that aren't reduced sodium) are too salty, so it's usually good to dilute the soy sauce with more water before adding it. Maybe even as high as a 1 to 1 ratio of soy sauce to water.
Loved it an easy to make

I grilled the meat. It was awesome!!!
I just made this and found it to be delicious, quick and easy. I will definitely make these again.
Very good recipe. I used low sodium soy sauce- it wasn’t salty enough for me so next time I’ll use regular soy sauce. I also cooked in a crock pot - next time I’ll use a grill. Very tasty!

this was really good! I made it exactly as written. I used a less expensive cut if neat, sliced it into bite sized pieces, marinated overnight then stir fried on high heat until the marinade was Carmelized. I doubled the recipe and cut up potatoes and used the rest of the sauce to cook it.

It's bit salty and too much sauce for 2 lbs of meat. I make Korean BBQ Ribs quite a bit and meat does not need to be floating in sauce. I recommend adding more green onions, garlic and sesame oil and blending them together in a blender or hand held blender. Also, as suggested by another reviewer, instead of water, add either Saki or Rice Wine (unsweetened) - it'll help tenderize the meat. Be sure to taste the sauce before adding to the meat to make sure you it's to your liking.
Best kalbi recipe
Amazing flavor!

Everyone said this is the best meat they'd ever had. I just mixed the whole marinate together at the same time rather than doing it in two steps. Otherwise followed the recipe.
Very good! No leftovers. Used pork rib tips. Baked in marinade half hour covered. Then grill.

Thanks for sharing the recipe! I made a couple tweaks based off other reviews and my own experience and overall it tasted delicious. I omitted the water step and had to cook my short ribs for 30 minutes vs. 20 minutes. Lastly, I flipped the ribs before I broiled them. I don't have a grill so this technique made them as good as grilled. So glad I don't have to buy marinades anymore. I love being able to make it from scratch and know exactly what is in that sauce. I will make it again since the family (of 6) loved it! I served it with steamed napa cabbage and Lumpia Shanghai.
used apple juice instead of water. forgot to add the ginger I bought and will try that next time. very yummy!

Delicious!! Altho I used country style pork ribs, & the slow cooker method..the results were tasty, fall apart tender ribs in a delightful broth! After skimming the fat off, we doused the meat & some white rice with it and YUMMM! Family enjoyed this & we'll definitely make again. Thank you!

Followed recipe except in place of water I used about a cup of fresh pineapple chunks in water. Marinated beef short ribs for 48 hours, then grilled them. They were excellent! We buy beef shares for meat, and it is wrapped in paper. It said "short ribs" on the package, and that was what I searched, but I don't think I had the best kind of meat for this recipe. I will make it again when I know what I'm working with, and I will try the idea someone had of using pineapple juice instead of water. I will also marinate it longer (I did 3 hours). I had to use tapioca flour to thicken the sauce for serving with sides - it wouldn't cook down in the 25 minutes I had. The sauce was delicious on our rice.
The male members of my family loved it! Normally they just want chicken this or that but they loved this recipe. I made it exactly and will not change a thing. Thank you!!!!
Used the comments from another and baked it 375 for 20 mins then 5 mins under the broiler and it was perfect!

I followed this recipe exactly, but maybe expected too much. I didn't find these tender at all. the marinade was very good, but found the ribs way too tough for my family's liking. Won't be making this again.
Too sweet and no balance to the flavors, I thought I'd try it . Really typical of Korean food
Excellent! Just as good as our favorite Hawaiian joint!
Great recipe. Did not need to alter one thing! I marinated the short ribs for 8 hours and they were perfect. I think marinating them longer might have made them too salty.

This recipe makes my husband fall in love with me all over again every time I make it. Instead of water I use a half cup of no-pulp orange juice, and I add about a teaspoon of ground ginger root. I also do what another user said, bake at 375 for 20 minutes and then broil for 5. Excellent!

It's definitely a recipe to try but I tweak it a little so it's not too salty. Turned out to be the best fall off the bone ribs. Thanks for recipe. For unknown reason, photo I uploaded and submitted did not take.
This was AMAZING! I absolutely love this recipe!!! I added more garlic because HELLO!! GARLIC!!!
This is an awesome recipe! We have made it for several dinner guests and everyone loved it. I add a little extra garlic but it’s not necessary.
I love Kalbi and now I have the perfect recipe. It was delicious. Next time I will marinate overnight. I just decided to make it today. Awesome.
absolutely delicious....used different ribs (less meat) which was not enough....next time bones with more meat!

Super simple and super delicious! My only mistake is forgetting the kimchi to go with it! One change I would make, only for aesthetics, to add sesame seeds on top along with fresh cut green green onions :)

Very good marinade, added fresh minced ginger, black and regular toasted sesame seeds, and diced shallots, grilled and served with garlic jasmine rice and grilled whole green onions.
My family loved it. I didn’t change a thing. It was perfect. Thank you for sharing

I made this as written, marinating it overnight. I used a low sodium soy sauce, and that was still too salty but the flavor was outstanding. I don't know much about Korean food but really love the taste of this dish. The saltiness was offset by the rice I served it with but it was still too salty. Next time, I'll decrease the soy sauce to our taste and see how it comes out. Otherwise, this one is a keeper. Thanks for sharing.
I loved this on pork
so good.delish!!!! Idid put teriyaki glaze on then before putting under the broiler...cant even describe how yummy. will make again!
My short ribs turned out really GOOD!!.??
I used flank steak instead of ribs and grilled it. Fantastic!!!
Great recipe!!! I made the dish and added shrimp fried rice and my family just love it!!!

I used a pureed pear to replace the brown sugar, and only added a small handful of brown sugar (since my pear wasn't as sweet as I would like). Using fruit or soda's are very common in korean cooking and I prefer it. I let it marinate overnight and cooked it the following afternoon on the grill. You should watch the meat carefully, because cooking 7 minutes on each side would have definitely burnt my meat!
Easy, made an extra recipe of marinade and let it sit over night. Then followed as directed. I loved it!!!!

We have made this a few times and love it! Makes a mess of the grill but worth it.

After the 24 hrs, I placed them on a grated grill and put them on a hot bbq, stirring every minute or so until the meat was caramelized on the outside, which didn't take long. I then served them as Korean tacos and they were devoured by the whole family, everyone absolutely loved them!

Thank you for the recipe.
I was stationed in Korea for a year and I miss the food so much. When I found this recipe it made me miss the food a little less because this recipe is right on the money.
I love this dish one of my favorites!

I am half Korean and always in search of a "go to" kalbi marinade as there are so many versions out there (including my mom's tasty marinade). After much trial and error of many recipes (including my mom's), this is now my go to kalbi marinade recipe. Even my own mom (who is an excellent cook) said that this marinade was better than hers!! I made a couple of tweaks and have the following suggestions:
- Instead of 3/4 cup water, I used 1 cup (think another reviewer also suggested this)
- I used tons of garlic (I must use about a head of garlic)
- I peeled a kiwi and then minced it to add to the marinade. Kiwi helps tenderize the meat.
- I usually double the marinade as I made 2-3 packs of the Korean style kalbi meat and use a huge size ziploc bag to place the marinade and meat
- Definitely marinate this over night (and flip the ziploc bag to the other side in the next morning).
Great kalbi marinade!
Phenomenal recipe. The longer you marinade, the better. This tastes as good as the authentic Korean BBQ you can find in Korean communities, including Hawaii.

These are great! Like others, though, these ended up in the oven at 375 for 20 minutes and then broiled for 5 min. I took the marinade and thickened it on the stovetop with a cornstarch slurry (2tsp cornstarch to 1/4 cup water) and made a sauce for the rice and veggies. So tasty! Make sure you get good ribs though. We got cheap ones and had to pick out bone shards...
This was a hit for my family.. Definitely will be making this again..

The whole family really enjoyed these Ribs
Not something my wife usually enjoys.
Super yummy!!! I even used the marinade for some chicken thighs I had and they were delicious too
Much to greasy "

I made this exactly as written. I cooked it on the barbeque, which I think made it extra succulent. Don't use too high a heat, and do not walk away. Between the fatty meat and sugary marinade it will burn quickly. Just excellent!

Kids & hubby loved it. I Made 3 lbs of ribs & all gone in one sitting. WOW! No leftovers! Made exactly as per the recipe. I used a high quality soya sauce that I do not find salty at all (I buy in large jars at local Asian supermarket). This is a sweet sauce. We grilled on the BBQ & found it tasted best with a little char on the beef! Marinated overnight (12 hrs.) before I cooked.
I will make it AGAIN, AND AGAIN AND AGAIN!
We've made this twice and it was good both times. The second time I used a boneless rib which was less messy.
Followed the recipe and it turned out well. We ate it with rice.
a little tough even after marinating overnight. flavor very good though

Husband loved these. Could not get the ribs cut this way so used regular short ribs which take sooo long to get tender. So I braised in oven on 300 for 2 hours . Took marinade and reduced it to a syrup. Then painted on the ribs and baked for 30 more minutes. Very very good.
O. M.G. it my daughter favorite recipe now have to keep ribs in freezer just for her to do this recipe is give it a 5 star is so good you have to try it
Excellent! Enough said.
I used "country style beef short ribs" which were clearly not cut off of beef ribs. Otherwise I followed the recipe. Not likely to make again.

Fabulous recipe. I marinated the meat for 36 hours, and made two changes to the marinade. Instead of water, use pineapple juice (the citric acid makes the meat even more tender) and add a tablespoon of grated ginger for a bit of heat and flavour. My wife and both agreed it was the best short ribs we had ever had
I was really disappointed by this recipe. Lack luster flavor.
Used the marinade on pork chops instead of ribs. It was delicious and will be added to our menu.
Awesome! I usually get this when I go to the Hawaiian food place. This tasted the same as theirs! Also my kids couldn't get enough!
Follow this recipe to a tee every time and my family loves it!! It's easy and I always grill them even in fall. We frequent a Korean BBQ restaurant and this is pretty darn close if not equivalent.

Amazing taste and very easy to do. The only thing I added was some grated ginger and more garlic to the marinade. I also let it marinade for 2 days in the refrigerator (not planned it just worked out that way). Also make sure you buy a well marbled flanken rib, such as from Sam's Club, to ensure your end result is tender. After all these are still ribs and I'm sure you wouldn't expect ribs that have been grilled for 10-14 minutes to be tender??? So marbling is important. This is a keeper and we will be making them again! Enjoy!
I liked it but wished the flavor was stronger.
